snippet: A recent makeover inspired a visit to Ferragamo’s Fifth Avenue flagship.
abstract: Alexandra Jacobs reviews Salvatore Ferragamo's renovated Fifth Avenue flagship store, featuring a wide selection of colorful and flamboyant apparel and shoes. Photos (M)0
lead_paragraph: COMPARED with its heavy-breathing, hot-blooded brethren, Fendi, Missoni, Versace et al., Ferragamo has always seemed like one of Italy's quieter sons of fashion. There have been no sequined ''it'' purses with silly names; no splashy collaborations with big-box retailers. I tended to think of it as a place where the freakishly delicate of feet get shod -- widths, or narrownesses, go down to AAAA -- and as a reliable purveyor of men's belts and ties for formal occasions.
